DesignSmell.Name: Abstract class is subclass of a concrete class
DesignSmell.Desc: An abstract class being subclass of a concrete class reflects poor design and a conflict in the model inheritance hierarchy

DesignSmell.Name: Composition cycles
DesignSmell.Desc: There exist composition cycles in the design.

DesignSmell.Name: Composite end is a super class
DesignSmell.Desc: Class contains one of its superclasses, with cardinality 1 in the composition end (this is not finitely satisfiable).

DesignSmell.Name: Cycle reflexive association
DesignSmell.Desc: Reflexive association that has two member ends: x1..x2 and y1..y2, where y1>x2
DesignSmell.OCLexpression: Association.allInstances()->exists(a|a.endType-> asSet()->size() =1 and a.memberEnd-> exists(e1,e2|e1.upper<>-1 and e1.upper<e2.lower))

DesignSmell.Name: Isolated class
DesignSmell.Desc: A design should not have an isolated class (a class which is not involved in an association or in the inheritance hierarchy)
DesignSmell.OCLexpression: Class.allInstances()->exists(c | c.association-> isEmpty() and c.superClass->isEmpty() and c.subClass->isEmpty())
DesignSmell.SelectExpression: Class.allInstances()->select(c | c.association-> isEmpty() and c.superClass->isEmpty() and c.subClass->isEmpty())

DesignSmell.Name: A class is contained in two classes, and the cardinality in the composition end of one of them is 1
DesignSmell.Desc: A class is contained in two classes, and the cardinality in the composition end of one of them is 1

DesignSmell.Name: A class is contained in two classes
DesignSmell.Desc: A class is contained in two classes
DesignSmell.OCLexpression: Class.allInstances->exists(c| c.association.memberEnd->select(type <> c and isComposite = true)->asSet()->size()>1)
DesignSmell.SelectExpression: Class.allInstances->select(c| c.association.memberEnd->select(type <> c and isComposite = true)->asSet()->size()>1)

DesignSmell.Name: Root class is not an abstract class
DesignSmell.Desc: A root class which has subclasses and does not participate in any association, is not abstract. This kind of class should be an abstract class
DesignSmell.OCLexpression: Class.allInstances->exists(c|c.superClass->isEmpty() and not c.subClass->isEmpty() and c.isAbstract = false and c.association->isEmpty())
DesignSmell.SelectExpression: Class.allInstances->select(c|c.superClass->isEmpty() and not c.subClass->isEmpty() and c.isAbstract = false and c.association->isEmpty())

DesignSmell.Name: Duplicate attributes among all subclasses
DesignSmell.Desc: An attribute is repeated (with the same definition) among all specific classes of a hierarchy

DesignSmell.Name: Abstract class has only one subclass
DesignSmell.Desc: Abstract class is super to only one class (it nullifies the usefulness of the abstract class).

DesignSmell.Name: Redundant generalization paths
DesignSmell.Desc: There exists redundant generalization paths. A generalization is redundant if it could be implied from other generalizations in the model

DesignSmell.Name: Descendant reference
DesignSmell.Desc: A class that associates to a descendant class

DesignSmell.Name: Overloaded class
DesignSmell.Desc: No class is overloaded with attributes (10-max by default)

DesignSmell.Name: A class is really involved in so many associations
DesignSmell.Desc: The number of associations in which the class participates should not be higher than ten

DesignSmell.Name: Deep inheritance hierarchy
DesignSmell.Desc: No hierarchy is too deep (5-level max by default) â€“ a.k.a. depth of inheritance tree (DIT).

DesignSmell.Name: Too many direct children
DesignSmell.Desc: No class has too many direct children (10-max by default) - a.k.a. number of children (NOC).

DesignSmell.Name: God class in the design
DesignSmell.Desc: The class has more than 60 attributes and operations.

DesignSmell.Name: Class naming PascalCase convention
DesignSmell.Desc: The name of classes should start with a capital letter (PascalCase convention)

DesignSmell.Name: Attributes are named after their feature class
DesignSmell.Desc: Attributes are not named after their feature class (e.g., an attribute paperID in class Paper).

DesignSmell.Name: Class name is a Java keyword
DesignSmell.Desc: Class name is not a Java keyword.

DesignSmell.Name: Class name is a C++ keyword
DesignSmell.Desc: Class name is a C++ keyword.
DesignSmell.OCLexpression: Class.allInstances()->exists(c| let cppKeywords = Set{'asm','else','new','this', 'auto','enum','operator','throw', 'bool','explicit','private','true', 'break','export','protected','try', 'case','extern','public','typedef', 'catch','false','register','typeid', 'char','float','reinterpret_cast','typename', 'class','for','return','union', 'const','friend','short','unsigned', 'const_cast','goto','signed','using', 'continue','if','sizeof','virtual', 'default','inline','static','void', 'delete','int','static_cast','volatile', 'do','long','struct','wchar_t', 'double','mutable','switch','while', 'dynamic_cast','namespace','template', 'true', 'false', 'null' } in cppKeywords->includes(c.name))
DesignSmell.SelectExpression: Class.allInstances()->select(c| let cppKeywords = Set{'asm','else','new','this', 'auto','enum','operator','throw', 'bool','explicit','private','true', 'break','export','protected','try', 'case','extern','public','typedef', 'catch','false','register','typeid', 'char','float','reinterpret_cast','typename', 'class','for','return','union', 'const','friend','short','unsigned', 'const_cast','goto','signed','using', 'continue','if','sizeof','virtual', 'default','inline','static','void', 'delete','int','static_cast','volatile', 'do','long','struct','wchar_t', 'double','mutable','switch','while', 'dynamic_cast','namespace','template', 'true', 'false', 'null' } in cppKeywords->includes(c.name))

DesignSmell.Name: Attribute naming camelCase convention
DesignSmell.Desc: Attribute (association ends) names should start with a lowercase letter.

DesignSmell.Name: Operation naming camelCase convention
DesignSmell.Desc: Operation names should start with a lower case letter.
